etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Brain: a journal of neurology. From German Porencephalie from ancient Greek πόρος + ἐγκέϕαλος brain + German -ie; compare -encephaly

definitions: A disorder characterized by the presence of one or more, usually congenital, cyst-like spaces in the brain, especially in the cerebral cortex, typically communicating with the ventricular system.
